oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Lowenstein Brothers Department Store
B. Lowenstein's
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rudner, Henry
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Claiming Space
Business Districts
Storefronts
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Four story brick and stone building with decorative terracotta panels,and round arched window openings.

B.Lowenstein's Department Store, on Main Street in downtown Memphis, was one of the city's four major department stores. This building is the original location for the firm founded by Jewish immigrant Elias Lowenstein, who came to Memphis in 1854. Lowenstein's closed in 1981.
